page.title: 19CHIEF TECH. R.A.F.WADDINGTON
page.content: The Chief Technician has worked all his life in the R.A.F. but is having to leave since there are too many chief technicians and the R.A.F are looking for younger men. He hopes to get a job with the U.S. Forces in Germany, though his family will remain at home in Waddington. The Chief Technician rises at 6.30am, has breakfast and a cup of tea, leaves at 7.00am and gets to work at 7.30am. He is in charge of the 5 men who look after the Vulcans. During the day they will wash and service the two planes, taking lunch between 1.00pm and 1.30pm and finishing at 4.00pm. Then the Chief Technician has half an hour break, then locks up and returns home for tea. In the evening he might read the paper and then go out.
